question: Good morning Abdullah... I brought you this... It's almost new. Three hundred cartridges... The hunter who gave it to me said you can hit up to three kilometers away.
answer: How much do you want for everything?

question: One thousand dirhams.
answer: One thousand dirhams? I'll give you one thousand and a goat.

question: With this rifle, your sons will be able to kill plenty of jackals. Let one of your sons shoot.
answer: Let Yussef shoot.

question: Yussef, Yussef... Yussef... What are you doing? I told you not to spy on her again. I said don't spy on her.
answer: What the hell do you care?

question: Come on, let's go. Five to two.
answer: There's a jackal over there. Over there. What are you doing, you idiot? Zora doesn't mind.

question: She doesn't, but I do.
answer: This is between her and me.

question: You're both pigs. Next time I'm going to tell my dad.
answer: Stay out of this.

question: If you want me to stay out of it, don't do it.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Hassan said that it could hit things three kilometers away, but it can't even reach that rock over there.
answer: That's because you don't know how to shoot. Give me the rifle.

question: See, it can't reach it.
answer: Give me another bullet. See.

question: Yeah, but that's not three kilometers. Yussef, come here. I bet you the bullet can't hit that far away. These fucking bullets aren't any good.
answer: You're not aiming right. What'll you give me if I hit that car?

question: I'll shoot. You see? Nothing happens.
answer: Let me shoot.

question: I won...
answer: No, I won.

question: Yes... yes sir... yes sir, Mrs. Rachel told me...I'm very sorry. How is Mrs. Susan?... No sir, don't worry... Your dad is calling.
answer: Hi dad... dad, guess what? Today, at school, they brought some baby chickens...I held one in my hand. He was really little and he was all warm... Dad, are you ok?...And Mariana wanted to take one home, but the teacher didn't let her...

question: Did you brush your teeth?
answer: Will you tell us a story?

question: One and then you're going to sleep. Once there was a hawk who wanted to fly higher than everyone else. He trained every day and hunted little birds so he could eat them and be strong.
answer: Pajaritos? Little birds?

question: Of course, that's what hawks eat. So, one day the hawk flew so, so high that it crashed into an airplane. It fainted and started to fall. And when it was about to hit the ground, all the birds flew toward him and saved him.
answer: They saved him?

question: Yes, and when the hawk was healthy again he went to talk to the birds and said Did you like it?
answer: No. Leave it on.

question: Quedamos en que se iban a dormir con la luz apagada.
answer: But I'm scared.

question: No pasa nada.
answer: I'm scared that what happened to Pat is gonna happen to me.

question: A ti no te va a pasar eso...
answer: Pat died while she was sleeping.

question: Go to sleep. I'll sit here with you, but you can't talk anymore. Yes...
answer: Amelia, it's Richard. We're going to have to be here a few more days here in Morocco than we expected and Rachel wasn't able to find anyone to take care of the kids.

question: Your sister-in-law promised me to find someone.
answer: Amelia, this is very serious.

question: It's because... I told Mrs. Jones three months ago that today is my son's wedding.
answer: Amelia, this is an emergency. Cancel your son's wedding. I'll pay for another one.

question: Sir, everything is ready. Can't anyone come take care of the kids? It's just one day.
answer: We need you, Amelia... hold on. Amelia, we're really counting on you. I have to go. Goodbye.

question: None, because he started to like quesadillas.
answer: Is the bus here?

question: Yes, but today you're not going to school.
answer: Why?

question: We have things to do. I just want you to take of them for today. And she won't go out? Ok, thanks. I'll call you tomorrow. Please, it's my son's wedding. I helped you out with that thing with your boyfriend. Just for the day, Lucia. I'll be back for them tonight. Tell her they're your nephews.
answer: Are we going to see your house?

question: Yes, you're going to see my house.
answer: Is it far?

question: Not very.
answer: Good morning Aunt Amelia.

question: Good morning.
answer: Are they coming?

question: I couldn't find anyone to leave them with. Their parents aren't coming back today.
answer: Why bring them, they're just going to make trouble.

question: They're good kids.
answer: I know a woman who can take care of them.

question: Santiago, I have to take them. I can't leave them with just anybody.
answer: What if you lose your job?

question: I'll have a chicken cous-cous and a Coke, please.
answer: What do you have that doesn't have fat in it? I'll have the fried eggplant and a diet Coke. Then a regular Coke.

question: Look, look This country is incredible.
answer: Richard, why did we come here?

question: What d'you mean why? I thought you would like it.
answer: Really

question: To forget everything, to be alone.
answer: Alone? Throw out the ice.

question: The Coke is warm.
answer: Yeah, but you don't know what kind of water is in there.

question: Why can't you ever relax. You're always stressed.
answer: You're the one stressing me out. You're why I can't relax.

question: You could if you tried.
answer: Tried? Don't you think I tried?

question: You're never going to forgive me, are you?
answer: Do you even know what I'm talking about?

question: Susan, please; we didn't come all this way just to argue.
answer: Oh, we didn't? Then when are we supposed to "argue"? Or are you planning on running away again? I don't have any money... I don't have any...

question: Here.
answer: What are you doing?

question: The ball was out. That was out. You're not just deaf, you're blind. You're an asshole. It wasn't my fault, it was the ref. I'm gonna fuck your dad to get rid of my mood.
answer: What do you want to eat?

question: I said I'd meet my friends from the team at Eve's.
answer: Weren't we going to have lunch together?

question: Dad, I told you I was going to eat with them, but you never pay attention to me. My mother always paid attention to me.
answer: Why do you want to fight? I miss your mother too. I'm doing what I can, sweetie. Don't forget you have the dentist at four. I love you very much.

question: Why all the way in the corner?
answer: Because of the view. Do you like him?

question: Tell him I couldn't read his lips.
answer: What's the matter?

question: They look at us like we're monsters.
answer: Oh, come off it. What are you doing?

question: Don't talk to her like that. Something we ate make us sick so we came back.
answer: What are you doing here?

question: Something we ate gave us a stomach ache.
answer: And is that why you're insulting your sister?

question: We were feeling really ill.
answer: The goats are going to feel even worse if they don't eat. Take them out again.

question: D'you think something happened?
answer: I don't know.

question: People were screaming. It was your fault.
answer: It was both our faults. We both shot. Swear to me you'll never say anything. Swear. Nobody, never.

question: Thank you, I'll see you tomorrow. Tell your mother to prepare dinner.
answer: Mother, mother, father says he wants to have dinner now.

question: Did you kill any jackals?
answer: We shot at them, but didn't hit them.

question: You have to kill them. If not they're going to eat all the goats.
answer: Why are you home so late?

question: They closed the road, and we had to take the long way around. Apparently some terrorists killed an American tourist.
answer: An American?

question: Yes, the terrorists attacked a tour bus on the road.
answer: But there aren't any terrorists here.

question: My mom told us Mexico is really dangerous.
answer: Yes, it's full of Mexicans. Are you hungry? Do you like popsicles?

question: What's this flavor called?
answer: Cajeta... it's called cajeta.

question: Cayeto...
answer: No, cajeta... cajeta...

question: Are they crashed cars?
answer: Yes...

question: Did lots of people die?
answer: I guess so...

question: Hi mom, how're you doing?
answer: Son, you look like Pedro Infante. Where's the bride?

question: She's not here yet.
answer: What d'you mean she's not here yet?

question: Well, she ain't here.
answer: Look son, these are Mike and Debbie, the kids I take care of.

question: Is anybody a doctor? Please Where's the nearest hospital?
answer: It's far away, about four hours. There's a clinic that's a little closer, about an hour and a half to the south. By bus it'll take us about two hours and a half though.

question: Does that takes away from Marrakesh?
answer: Yes, but it's the closest thing we've got.

question: I need your help. We were attacked.
answer: I don't understand...

question: Help... hospital...
answer: I don't understand you sir.

question: Tell him we need his help. Let's take her to the clinic. We've got to get her to a hospital. Shut up, god damn it!
answer: It hurts, it hurts...

question: Easy, sweetie, easy...
answer: It hurts... it hurts so much...

question: Isn't there anywhere else we can take her?
answer: We can take her to my town. It's near here and there's a doctor. In the meantime we can call Erfourd for an ambulance.

question: Ok.
answer: Make a right onto the next road.

question: Are we here?
answer: Yes sir, this is my house.

question: You can't leave us here.
answer: What's the use in staying?

question: In case I need the bus.
answer: They can go drop us off and then come back for you.

question: Yes... Rachel? It's Richard...
answer: Are you still in Moroccco?

question: Yes, we're still in Morocco...Rachel, there was an accident, your sister was shot...
answer: What? Who shot her?

question: I don't know... We were shot at from some hills.
answer: Is she ok?

question: She was hit in her neck and shoulder. Rachel, she's not doing well... I need you to tell the embassy as soon as possible... wait... and call Mark...
answer: Where are you?

question: Were in Tazarine, T-a-z-a-r-I-n-e Three hours southwest of Erfoud... in the desert... it's a town... there's no hospital... There's nothing here at all...
answer: Where are you calling me from?

question: From a shop. Rachel, this is urgent... urgent... call the embassy... They have to help us... call James too...
answer: Why did they shoot her?

question: He says he is very sorry about your wife.
answer: Tell him that I want to ask him some questions.

question: Can he ask you some questions?
answer: Do you have any enemies in this country?

question: Anti-muslim magazines?
answer: No, magazine magazines.

question: No, normal magazines.
answer: Tell him we need to get my wife out of here. Ask him if the ambulance is on its way.

question: He wants to get his wife out of here. He wants to know if the ambulance is on its way.
answer: Tell him the federal police are in charge of this, that they are going to send the ambulance.

question: He says the federal police are already in charge, that they are going to send the ambulance.
answer: Hey, did your cousin finally end up getting married?

question: Are you ready?
answer: Yeah, I'm just going to get my bag.

question: The cops came again?
answer: Yeah. They hadn't come in nine months. But these were different cops.

question: Did they come to ask about your mothers' death?
answer: No, but they're probably going to ask my dad about the same things.

question: They're just not convinced, are they?
answer: Believe it or not, I liked one of the cops.

question: Are you sure it was here?
answer: Sure. I drive down this road every day. The American tried to stop me right here. I was scared. He was covered in blood and I was coming from picking up my grandson from his work.

question: Where was the bus?
answer: Over there.

question: Look further to the right. Why did you wait so long to contact the police?
answer: I had to drive my grandson home.

question: Yes.
answer: Drop your weapon.

question: It's not a weapon, it's my knife.
answer: Drop it, now... Get down on the floor... face down...

question: Why did you shoot at the bus?
answer: I didn't shoot at anyone.

question: Then who, you idiot?
answer: It wasn't me.

question: That was your rifle.
answer: No, not anymore, I sold it today.

question: Hey, do you know where Abdullah Adboum lives?
answer: Yes. Over there, you have to cross those mountains.

question: They told us he lived around here.
answer: No, we just live here with our mother. Abdullah lives over there.

question: If you're lying to me I'm going to come back and cut your balls off.
answer: You can come back whenever you like.

question: Me? Why?
answer: No, they're not looking for you... they're looking for us...

question: You? Why?
answer: Because of what happened to the tourist...

question: Yes, but you killed her.
answer: What the hell are you talking about?

question: Yussef killed the American and he spies on Zora naked and Zora lets him watch her...
answer: What is your brother talking about?

question: You're not going to give her any anesthetic?
answer: No, he doesn't use anesthetic.

question: What kind of doctor is he?
answer: He's a veterinarian, but he is good.

question: Tell him that if I don't stitch up her wound she may bleed to death.
answer: If he doesn't sew up the wound, she may bleed to death.

question: And tell him her clavicle is broken. We have to fasten a splint to it.
answer: He says she has a broken bone and he has to put a splint on it.

question: Honey, this is going to hurt a little.
answer: Richard, don't let him... Don't let him, don't let him.

question: Calm down... calm down... Susan, they have to sew you up... relax...
answer: No, no...no..

question: I don't give a shit...
answer: My love, don't move.

question: I want to call the kids.
answer: You can't move, calm down.

question: I want to talk to them.
answer: You can't; there's only one phone in town. I'll call them later.

question: What is he saying? Fuck you. We're gettin' out of here. We've gotta talk to you. We're leaving.
answer: You can't leave us like this.

question: There are old people here and the heat is getting to them.
answer: At least wait until an ambulance comes.

question: One man almost fainted in the bus and there's a woman who needs to get back in time to take her medication.
answer: Is there anyone around here who can take them in?

question: It's not about that. Well let him come, then. And lots of other people aren't in any condition to keep waiting, can't you see?
answer: Just wait, the ambulance should be here any minute now.

question: When are my parents getting back?
answer: Pronto...muy pronto...

question: They told me they were coming back today.
answer: Se quedaron ms rato.

question: My dad's coming back with my mom.
answer: Yes. Yes he is.

question: I don't want him to leave again.
answer: He won't.

question: I miss Pat.
answer: Yo tambin hijito, yo tambin.

question: Your papers... Where you comin' from?
answer: From a wedding.

question: Who are they?
answer: They're her nephews.

question: Should there be one?
answer: Hi.

question: Hey there, sweetie. Tell me, is this lady your aunty?
answer: No, she's not my aunty.

question: Are you drunk?
answer: Me, sir? No.

question: Get out of the car.
answer: Why, officer?

question: See, I told you you shouldn't have brought them. I told you. I told you..
answer: Santiago, stop acting crazy and stop the car... Santiago, stop... Everything's all right sweeties...

question: Fucking asshole gringo mother-fuckers, here they come...
answer: Stop... Stop...

question: Get out...
answer: Are you crazy? Where?

question: Get out. I'll lose these bastards and then I'll come back for you.
answer: Santiago, calm down...

question: Aunt Amelia, they're going to get us, get out god damn it...
answer: Come with me, dears.

question: Thank you.
answer: Thank you, Yamil.

question: Is that your daughter?
answer: The fourth of eight.

question: Eight?
answer: Do you have kids? Just two?

question: Three... Yes, just two.
answer: You should have more.

question: What about you? How many wives do you have?
answer: I can only afford one.

question: And is this where you live?
answer: No, this is where my family lives. I live in Marrakesh. But I come whenever I can...

question: I need to make a phone call.
answer: We can't stay here any longer. It's going to get dark soon. Lots of people aren't feeling well and its dangerous to stay here.

question: Stop fucking with me.
answer: Don't you dare push me.

question: Oh no?
answer: What are you doing, you stupid fuck?

question: Leave asshole.
answer: Fuck you.

question: Hey, take it easy.
answer: I'm fed up with that asshole.

question: Try to calm down.
answer: Calm down? My wife is dying up there.

question: Come with us.
answer: Where the fuck do you want me to take her?

question: Try to understand, many of them can't go on. Tell me, honestly, is there any point in us staying?
answer: You leave and I'll kill you...

question: You leave and I'll kill you...
answer: Hello...

question: Rachel... What's going on? Nobody's come... Who have you talked to... we need help...she's dying...
answer: What d'you mean dying?

question: She's very weak, please, you've got to do something.
answer: Mark, your business partner, already called someone in the Secretary of State, they're going to help you...

question: You can't just make these stupid fucking calls, you've got to do something...
answer: Richard calm down, we're doing everything we can.

question: How the fuck do you expect me to calm down? Susan is dying...
answer: I'm flying over there tonight.

question: There's no time. I need to get Susan out of here now! Put Mark on the phone...
answer: I don't know if I can find him.

question: What's happening?
answer: A boy is walking this way.

question: Is he armed?
answer: It doesn't look like it.

question: What are the others doing?
answer: A man is holding somebody injured.

question: Is the other one still walking this way?
answer: Yes.

question: Aim.
answer: I killed the American, I was the only one who shot at you... They did nothing... nothing... Kill me, but save my brother, he did nothing... nothing...

question: On the ground...
answer: Save my brother...

question: On the ground...
answer: Save my brother... please...

question: I can't walk anymore.
answer: We have to keep walking.

question: Why is the air so hot?
answer: Because coyotes and snakes and quails have already breathed that air.

question: We're breathing the same air animals breathe?
answer: Yes.

question: And it doesn't rot?
answer: No, it doesn't rot. We all breathe this air.

question: So am I.
answer: Just a little further and we'll go look for water. We're going to rest here for a while.

question: What if there are snakes?
answer: No, there aren't any. Come, lie down.

question: What happening?
answer: Stay still.

question: Why are we hiding if we didn't do anything wrong?
answer: Because they think we did something wrong.

question: That's not true
answer: No, sweetie, I'm not bad. I just did something stupid. I love you very much, sweetie. Debbie, we've got to go. Debbie, sweetheart, wake up. Sweetie, I'm going to go look for help. Stay here and don't move.

question: I'm not staying here alone.
answer: Honey, you have to take care of Debbie.

question: I'm going with you.
answer: I won't be long. I promise. Stop, stop... Sir... sir... stop... Please help me. I have to go get two kids I left behind in the desert.

question: I won't be long. I promise. Stop, stop... Sir... sir... stop... Please help me. I have to go get two kids I left behind in the desert.
answer: Are they illegal immigrants?

question: No, they're American.
answer: When did you cross?

question: I didn't cross, I live here. Please, help me find these kids.
answer: Stand there and don't move. Attention base, I have a 4533...I have the suspect. You're under arrest. Turn around and put your hands behind your head.

question: I left those kids in the desert, I swear.
answer: Turn around, now. Which way are they?

question: Over there.
answer: Where are they?

question: They must be around here.
answer: This lady said they were here, but there's nobody.

question: I swear they're around here somewhere. They must be over that way.
answer: There's nobody here.

question: I left them about a kilometer in from the road.
answer: I don't believe you.

question: I swear they're around here.
answer: Maybe she's not, let's go.

question: Richard.
answer: What do you need?

question: Richard... if I die, take care of the kids. Especially Mike, he really needs you.
answer: You're not going to die. You can't die. You just can't.

question: Don't ever leave them again.
answer: No, I'm not going to leave them and don't you even think about leaving me, because I'll kill you like nobody's killed you before.

question: I peed my pants.
answer: What?

question: I couldn't hold it in and I peed.
answer: I'm going to tell Mike on you, so you never scold him again.

question: I need to pee again.
answer: Do you have a pot I can borrow? Can you leave us alone for a moment? Come, try it like this.

question: I can't. Now I can.
answer: Forgive me my love. When Pat died I didn't know what to do, the pain drove me crazy... I was scared, that's why I left... forgive me.

question: I was scared too... when I saw Pat lying still in his crib... It wasn't my fault, it wasn't... I couldn't do anything for him...
answer: No, it wasn't your fault. I was wrong... Shhh... it wasn't your fault my love, it wasn't anybody's fault... Pat just left... Forgive me, please.

question: Forgive me for not forgiving you.
answer: You missed; you got my leg. Does it hurt?

question: So much... so much...
answer: Anwar...Anwar...

question: Anwar...Anwar...
answer: What happened?

question: We've got to get her out of here. Where's the clinic?
answer: In Alnif, an hour and a half away from here.

question: Sweetie, you've got to hold on. Hello...
answer: Hello, Richard Jones?

question: Yes, speaking.
answer: I'm very sorry about what happened to your wife, but you can be sure that the culprits will be punished.

question: My wife is dying. She's in urgent need of medical attention.
answer: We're working on it...

question: We've been here for five hours. What the fuck are you waiting for?
answer: The Moroccan government won't let us use their airspace. They refused to acknowledge that this was an act of terrorism...

question: I can't wait anymore... I'm taking my wife to a clinic in Tinerhir right now...
answer: Stay put... we've settled the matter. A helicopter should arrive soon...

question: We can't wait any longer.
answer: The helicopter is on its way. Don't move.

question: My wife is in critical condition. How long is the chopper going to take?
answer: Soon... it'll be there soon... Be patient, it won't be long.

question: Is your full name Amelia Gloria Jordn Susilla?
answer: Yes sir.

question: Do you understand English?
answer: Yes sir.

question: Ma'am, it was a miracle that we found those kids. I don't know how you could leave them alone in the desert.
answer: I had to look for help.

question: Your reckless behavior endangered their lives.
answer: How are they?

question: That's none of your business, ma'am. You've committed serious crimes.
answer: I just took the kids to my son's wedding.

question: No ma'am, you did not just do that. You took them to another country without their parents' permission and you put them in danger.
answer: Sir, I raised these kids since they were born. I take care of them day and night. I feed them breakfast, lunch and dinner. I play with them. Mike and Debbie are like my own children.

question: But they are not your kids, ma'am.
answer: What about my nephew, Santiago?

question: I don't have any information on him. We located the parents in Morocco. They're very angry, but they've decided not to raise charges. Nevertheless, the government of the United States has deemed you were seriously breaking the law and has decided to immediately and definitively deport you.
answer: I've been living here for fifteen years. My things are here, I rent a house, I made my life here.

question: You should've thought of that beforehand.
answer: I want to talk to a lawyer.

question: If you attempt to take this to court, I assure you you will end up in jail. If you want my advice, accept the deportation and never come back.
answer: Do you have a cigarette? Thank you.

question: The last thing I'm worried about right now is the fucking press. Is she going to be ok? But she's going to be ok? Amelia?
answer: Yes sir.

question: How is everything?
answer: Ok sir, Mrs. Rachel told me. I'm very sorry. How is Mrs. Susan?

question: They're going to operate now... Amelia... take good care of the kids, and don't tell them anything...
answer: No sir, don't worry.

question: Put Mike on please.
answer: Hi dad.

question: Hey sweetie, how are you?
answer: Dad, guess what? Today, at school, they brought some baby chickens.

question: Oh really?
answer: I held one in my hand. He was really little and he was all warm. Dad, are you ok?

question: Yeah, I'm ok. Everything's fine.
answer: And Mariana wanted to take one home, but the teacher didn't let her...
